column4: i have a x1400 and i can only install the 64 bit version which doesnt support wine
i want to install the 32bit version
but X fails when i try to run the live disk
can anyone help me???
is there a wine equivalent program for 64 bit ubuntu?
No, but you can run 32 bit wine in 64 bit Ubuntu
But it is easier just to run 32bit Ubuntu if you are new
do you know why in 64bit i get a graphic error causing X to not load but no problems in 64 bit??
No, but I can try to get X started
press ctrl+alt+F1 to get to a terminal and run "sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg -phigh" and for the driver choose "vesa"
Then to start X again run: sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart
That won't get you full resolution though, so once it is actually installed run System -> Administration -> Restricted Driver Manager to get the drivers for your card
No
GNOME display manager still fails
You can either install fglrx from the liveCD or use the alternate install CD
Try "sudo apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx" then reconfigure X again but this time choose fglrx
that was me it couldnt retreieve the package
You need to be connected to the internet
I had my internet pluggeg in
Try running "udo ifconfig eth0 && sudo dhclient etho"
That's sudo at the begginging
okay, well i have to logg of the internet on this machine to get on the other one
anythign else i should know?
If it doesn't work the first time try running "sudo depmod -a" and try again
